case_vignette: A 10-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with sudden shortness of breath. He was playing in the school garden and suddenly started to complain of abdominal pain. He then vomited a few times. An hour later in the hospital, he slowly developed a rash on his chest, arms, and legs. His breathing became faster with audible wheezing. On physical examination, his vital signs are as follows: the temperature is 37.0°C (98.6°F), the blood pressure is 100/60 mm Hg, the pulse is 130/min, and the respiratory rate is 25/min. A rash is on his right arm, as shown in the image. After being administered appropriate treatment, the boy improves significantly, and he is able to breathe comfortably.
question: Which  is the best marker that could be measured in the serum of this boy to help establish a definitive diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I suddenly started having trouble breathing and my stomach hurts. Then I threw up a few times.
How old are you?
I'm 10 years old.
Are you experiencing any other symptoms like a rash, fever, or diarrhea?
Yes, I got a rash on my chest, arms, and legs, but no fever or diarrhea.
Have you had any recent exposure to new foods, medications, or environments?
I was just playing in the school garden when this all started.
Do you have any known allergies or has anything similar happened to you before?
I don't know if I have any allergies; nothing like this has happened to me before.
Have you been stung or bitten by any insects while playing in the garden?
I'm not sure if something bit me; I didn't notice anything like that.
Did any of your playmates experience similar symptoms, or are you the only one?
I'm the only one who got sick.
Has anyone in your family had similar symptoms or known allergic reactions?
Not that I'm aware of, no one has had these symptoms or allergic reactions.
Do you have any difficulty swallowing or changes in your voice?
I'm not having trouble swallowing and my voice hasn't changed.
Is the rash itchy or painful, and has it spread since it first appeared?
The rash isn't itchy or painful, and I haven't noticed it spreading.
Final Diagnosis: Probable allergic reaction, possibly to an unknown environmental allergen or insect sting. Urgent evaluation is recommended to rule out anaphylaxis.

The child is uncertain if they have any allergies, as this has never happened before. There was no noticeable bite or sting, and the child is the only one who got sick.
